steps.content: In the Scikit-Learn July 2017 changelog, what other predictor base command received a bug fix? Just give the name, not a path.

plan: Search for the Scikit-Learn changelog for July 2017.
Locate the section that discusses bug fixes.
Identify the specific predictor base command that received a bug fix.
Extract the name of that command.

facts_to_lookup.description: The changelog for Scikit-Learn in July 2017, detailing updates and bug fixes.

serp.title: Can't seem to update to sklearn 0.19 with pip?
serp.content: You can use use virtualenv in pip and install scikit-learn inside the venv. With that solution you dont have to remove sci-kit from conda.

Release history[¶](#release-history "Permalink to this headline")
=================================================================

Version 0\.19\.2[¶](#version-0-19-2 "Permalink to this headline")
-----------------------------------------------------------------

**October, 2018**

This release is exclusively in order to support Python 3\.7\.

### Related changes[¶](#related-changes "Permalink to this headline")

* `n_iter_` may vary from previous releases in
[`linear_model.LogisticRegression`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression.html#sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression "sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression") with `solver='lbfgs'` and
[`linear_model.HuberRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.HuberRegressor.html#sklearn.linear_model.HuberRegressor "sklearn.linear_model.HuberRegressor"). For Scipy \<\= 1\.0\.0, the optimizer could
perform more than the requested maximum number of iterations. Now both
estimators will report at most `max_iter` iterations even if more were
performed. [\#10723](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/10723) by [Joel Nothman](http://joelnothman.com).

Version 0\.19\.1[¶](#version-0-19-1 "Permalink to this headline")
-----------------------------------------------------------------

**October, 2017**

This is a bug\-fix release with some minor documentation improvements and
enhancements to features released in 0\.19\.0\.

Note there may be minor differences in TSNE output in this release (due to
[\#9623](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9623)), in the case where multiple samples have equal distance to some
sample.

### Changelog[¶](#changelog "Permalink to this headline")

#### API changes[¶](#api-changes "Permalink to this headline")

* Reverted the addition of `metrics.ndcg_score` and `metrics.dcg_score`
which had been merged into version 0\.19\.0 by error. The implementations
were broken and undocumented.
* `return_train_score` which was added to
[`model_selection.GridSearchCV`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV.html#sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV "sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV"),
[`model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV.html#sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV "sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV") and
[`model_selection.cross_validate`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate.html#sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate "sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate") in version 0\.19\.0 will be changing its
default value from True to False in version 0\.21\. We found that calculating
training score could have a great effect on cross validation runtime in some
cases. Users should explicitly set `return_train_score` to False if
prediction or scoring functions are slow, resulting in a deleterious effect
on CV runtime, or to True if they wish to use the calculated scores.
[\#9677](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9677) by [Kumar Ashutosh](https://github.com/thechargedneutron) and [Joel
Nothman](http://joelnothman.com).
* `correlation_models` and `regression_models` from the legacy gaussian
processes implementation have been belatedly deprecated. [\#9717](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9717) by
[Kumar Ashutosh](https://github.com/thechargedneutron).

#### Bug fixes[¶](#bug-fixes "Permalink to this headline")

* Avoid integer overflows in [`metrics.matthews_corrcoef`](modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.matthews_corrcoef.html#sklearn.metrics.matthews_corrcoef "sklearn.metrics.matthews_corrcoef").
[\#9693](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9693) by [Sam Steingold](https://github.com/sam-s).
* Fix ValueError in [`preprocessing.LabelEncoder`](modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.LabelEncoder.html#sklearn.preprocessing.LabelEncoder "sklearn.preprocessing.LabelEncoder") when using
`inverse_transform` on unseen labels. [\#9816](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9816) by [Charlie Newey](https://github.com/newey01c).
* Fixed a bug in the objective function for [`manifold.TSNE`](modules/generated/sklearn.manifold.TSNE.html#sklearn.manifold.TSNE "sklearn.manifold.TSNE") (both exact
and with the Barnes\-Hut approximation) when `n_components >= 3`.
[\#9711](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9711) by [@goncalo\-rodrigues](https://github.com/goncalo-rodrigues).
* Fix regression in [`model_selection.cross_val_predict`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict.html#sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict "sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict") where it
raised an error with `method='predict_proba'` for some probabilistic
classifiers. [\#9641](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9641) by [James Bourbeau](https://github.com/jrbourbeau).
* Fixed a bug where [`datasets.make_classification`](modules/generated/sklearn.datasets.make_classification.html#sklearn.datasets.make_classification "sklearn.datasets.make_classification") modified its input
`weights`. [\#9865](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9865) by [Sachin Kelkar](https://github.com/s4chin).
* [`model_selection.StratifiedShuffleSplit`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.StratifiedShuffleSplit.html#sklearn.model_selection.StratifiedShuffleSplit "sklearn.model_selection.StratifiedShuffleSplit") now works with multioutput
multiclass or multilabel data with more than 1000 columns. [\#9922](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9922) by
[Charlie Brummitt](https://github.com/crbrummitt).
* Fixed a bug with nested and conditional parameter setting, e.g. setting a
pipeline step and its parameter at the same time. [\#9945](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9945) by [Andreas
Müller](http://peekaboo-vision.blogspot.com) and [Joel Nothman](http://joelnothman.com).

Regressions in 0\.19\.0 fixed in 0\.19\.1:

* Fixed a bug where parallelised prediction in random forests was not
thread\-safe and could (rarely) result in arbitrary errors. [\#9830](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9830) by
[Joel Nothman](http://joelnothman.com).
* Fix regression in [`model_selection.cross_val_predict`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict.html#sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict "sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict") where it no
longer accepted `X` as a list. [\#9600](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9600) by [Rasul Kerimov](https://github.com/CoderINusE).
* Fixed handling of [`model_selection.cross_val_predict`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict.html#sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict "sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_predict") for binary classification with
`method='decision_function'`. [\#9593](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9593) by [Reiichiro Nakano](https://github.com/reiinakano) and core devs.
* Fix regression in [`pipeline.Pipeline`](modules/generated/sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline.html#sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline "sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline") where it no longer accepted
`steps` as a tuple. [\#9604](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9604) by [Joris Van den Bossche](https://github.com/jorisvandenbossche).
* Fix bug where `n_iter` was not properly deprecated, leaving `n_iter`
unavailable for interim use in
[`linear_model.SGDClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.SGDClassifier.html#sklearn.linear_model.SGDClassifier "sklearn.linear_model.SGDClassifier"), [`linear_model.SGDRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.SGDRegressor.html#sklearn.linear_model.SGDRegressor "sklearn.linear_model.SGDRegressor"),
[`linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier.html#sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier "sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier"),
[`linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor.html#sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor "sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor") and
[`linear_model.Perceptron`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.Perceptron.html#sklearn.linear_model.Perceptron "sklearn.linear_model.Perceptron"). [\#9558](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9558) by [Andreas Müller](http://peekaboo-vision.blogspot.com).
* Dataset fetchers make sure temporary files are closed before removing them,
which caused errors on Windows. [\#9847](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9847) by [Joan Massich](https://github.com/massich).
* Fixed a regression in [`manifold.TSNE`](modules/generated/sklearn.manifold.TSNE.html#sklearn.manifold.TSNE "sklearn.manifold.TSNE") where it no longer supported
metrics other than ‘euclidean’ and ‘precomputed’. [\#9623](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9623) by [Oli
Blum](https://github.com/oliblum90).

#### Enhancements[¶](#enhancements "Permalink to this headline")

* Our test suite and `utils.estimator_checks.check_estimators` can now be
run without Nose installed. [\#9697](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9697) by [Joan Massich](https://github.com/massich).
* To improve usability of version 0\.19’s [`pipeline.Pipeline`](modules/generated/sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline.html#sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline "sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline")
caching, `memory` now allows `joblib.Memory` instances.
This make use of the new [`utils.validation.check_memory`](modules/generated/sklearn.utils.validation.check_memory.html#sklearn.utils.validation.check_memory "sklearn.utils.validation.check_memory") helper.
[\#9584](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9584) by [Kumar Ashutosh](https://github.com/thechargedneutron)
* Some fixes to examples: [\#9750](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9750), [\#9788](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9788), [\#9815](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9815)
* Made a FutureWarning in SGD\-based estimators less verbose. [\#9802](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9802) by
[Vrishank Bhardwaj](https://github.com/vrishank97).

### Code and Documentation Contributors[¶](#code-and-documentation-contributors "Permalink to this headline")

With thanks to:

Joel Nothman, Loic Esteve, Andreas Mueller, Kumar Ashutosh,
Vrishank Bhardwaj, Hanmin Qin, Rasul Kerimov, James Bourbeau,
Nagarjuna Kumar, Nathaniel Saul, Olivier Grisel, Roman
Yurchak, Reiichiro Nakano, Sachin Kelkar, Sam Steingold,
Yaroslav Halchenko, diegodlh, felix, goncalo\-rodrigues,
jkleint, oliblum90, pasbi, Anthony Gitter, Ben Lawson, Charlie
Brummitt, Didi Bar\-Zev, Gael Varoquaux, Joan Massich, Joris
Van den Bossche, nielsenmarkus11

Version 0\.19[¶](#version-0-19 "Permalink to this headline")
------------------------------------------------------------

**August 12, 2017**

### Highlights[¶](#highlights "Permalink to this headline")

We are excited to release a number of great new features including
[`neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor`](modules/generated/sklearn.neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor.html#sklearn.neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor "sklearn.neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor") for anomaly detection,
[`preprocessing.QuantileTransformer`](modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.QuantileTransformer.html#sklearn.preprocessing.QuantileTransformer "sklearn.preprocessing.QuantileTransformer") for robust feature transformation,
and the [`multioutput.ClassifierChain`](modules/generated/sklearn.multioutput.ClassifierChain.html#sklearn.multioutput.ClassifierChain "sklearn.multioutput.ClassifierChain") meta\-estimator to simply account
for dependencies between classes in multilabel problems. We have some new
algorithms in existing estimators, such as multiplicative update in
[`decomposition.NMF`](modules/generated/sklearn.decomposition.NMF.html#sklearn.decomposition.NMF "sklearn.decomposition.NMF") and multinomial
[`linear_model.LogisticRegression`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression.html#sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression "sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression") with L1 loss (use `solver='saga'`).

Cross validation is now able to return the results from multiple metric
evaluations. The new [`model_selection.cross_validate`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate.html#sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate "sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate") can return many
scores on the test data as well as training set performance and timings, and we
have extended the `scoring` and `refit` parameters for grid/randomized
search [to handle multiple metrics](modules/grid_search.html#multimetric-grid-search).

You can also learn faster. For instance, the [new option to cache
transformations](modules/pipeline.html#pipeline-cache) in [`pipeline.Pipeline`](modules/generated/sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline.html#sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline "sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline") makes grid
search over pipelines including slow transformations much more efficient. And
you can predict faster: if you’re sure you know what you’re doing, you can turn
off validating that the input is finite using [`config_context`](modules/generated/sklearn.config_context.html#sklearn.config_context "sklearn.config_context").

We’ve made some important fixes too. We’ve fixed a longstanding implementation
error in [`metrics.average_precision_score`](modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.average_precision_score.html#sklearn.metrics.average_precision_score "sklearn.metrics.average_precision_score"), so please be cautious with
prior results reported from that function. A number of errors in the
[`manifold.TSNE`](modules/generated/sklearn.manifold.TSNE.html#sklearn.manifold.TSNE "sklearn.manifold.TSNE") implementation have been fixed, particularly in the
default Barnes\-Hut approximation. [`semi_supervised.LabelSpreading`](modules/generated/sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelSpreading.html#sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelSpreading "sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelSpreading") and
[`semi_supervised.LabelPropagation`](modules/generated/sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelPropagation.html#sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelPropagation "sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelPropagation") have had substantial fixes.
LabelPropagation was previously broken. LabelSpreading should now correctly
respect its alpha parameter.

### Changed models[¶](#changed-models "Permalink to this headline")

The following estimators and functions, when fit with the same data and
parameters, may produce different models from the previous version. This often
occurs due to changes in the modelling logic (bug fixes or enhancements), or in
random sampling procedures.

* [`cluster.KMeans`](modules/generated/sklearn.cluster.KMeans.html#sklearn.cluster.KMeans "sklearn.cluster.KMeans") with sparse X and initial centroids given (bug fix)
* [`cross_decomposition.PLSRegression`](modules/generated/sklearn.cross_decomposition.PLSRegression.html#sklearn.cross_decomposition.PLSRegression "sklearn.cross_decomposition.PLSRegression")
with `scale=True` (bug fix)
* [`ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier.html#sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier "sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier") and
[`ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor.html#sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor "sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor") where `min_impurity_split` is used (bug fix)
* gradient boosting `loss='quantile'` (bug fix)
* [`ensemble.IsolationForest`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.IsolationForest.html#sklearn.ensemble.IsolationForest "sklearn.ensemble.IsolationForest") (bug fix)
* [`feature_selection.SelectFdr`](modules/generated/sklearn.feature_selection.SelectFdr.html#sklearn.feature_selection.SelectFdr "sklearn.feature_selection.SelectFdr") (bug fix)
* [`linear_model.RANSACRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.RANSACRegressor.html#sklearn.linear_model.RANSACRegressor "sklearn.linear_model.RANSACRegressor") (bug fix)
* [`linear_model.LassoLars`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LassoLars.html#sklearn.linear_model.LassoLars "sklearn.linear_model.LassoLars") (bug fix)
* [`linear_model.LassoLarsIC`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LassoLarsIC.html#sklearn.linear_model.LassoLarsIC "sklearn.linear_model.LassoLarsIC") (bug fix)
* [`manifold.TSNE`](modules/generated/sklearn.manifold.TSNE.html#sklearn.manifold.TSNE "sklearn.manifold.TSNE") (bug fix)
* [`neighbors.NearestCentroid`](modules/generated/sklearn.neighbors.NearestCentroid.html#sklearn.neighbors.NearestCentroid "sklearn.neighbors.NearestCentroid") (bug fix)
* [`semi_supervised.LabelSpreading`](modules/generated/sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelSpreading.html#sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelSpreading "sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelSpreading") (bug fix)
* [`semi_supervised.LabelPropagation`](modules/generated/sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelPropagation.html#sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelPropagation "sklearn.semi_supervised.LabelPropagation") (bug fix)
* tree based models where `min_weight_fraction_leaf` is used (enhancement)

Details are listed in the changelog below.

(While we are trying to better inform users by providing this information, we
cannot assure that this list is complete.)

### Changelog[¶](#id1 "Permalink to this headline")

#### New features[¶](#new-features "Permalink to this headline")

Classifiers and regressors

* Added [`multioutput.ClassifierChain`](modules/generated/sklearn.multioutput.ClassifierChain.html#sklearn.multioutput.ClassifierChain "sklearn.multioutput.ClassifierChain") for multi\-label
classification. By [Adam Kleczewski](adamklec).
* Added solver `'saga'` that implements the improved version of Stochastic
Average Gradient, in [`linear_model.LogisticRegression`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression.html#sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression "sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression") and
[`linear_model.Ridge`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.Ridge.html#sklearn.linear_model.Ridge "sklearn.linear_model.Ridge"). It allows the use of L1 penalty with
multinomial logistic loss, and behaves marginally better than ‘sag’
during the first epochs of ridge and logistic regression.
[\#8446](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/8446) by [Arthur Mensch](https://amensch.fr).

Other estimators

* Added the [`neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor`](modules/generated/sklearn.neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor.html#sklearn.neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor "sklearn.neighbors.LocalOutlierFactor") class for anomaly
detection based on nearest neighbors.
[\#5279](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/5279) by [Nicolas Goix](https://perso.telecom-paristech.fr/~goix/) and [Alexandre Gramfort](http://alexandre.gramfort.net).
* Added [`preprocessing.QuantileTransformer`](modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.QuantileTransformer.html#sklearn.preprocessing.QuantileTransformer "sklearn.preprocessing.QuantileTransformer") class and
[`preprocessing.quantile_transform`](modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.quantile_transform.html#sklearn.preprocessing.quantile_transform "sklearn.preprocessing.quantile_transform") function for features
normalization based on quantiles.
[\#8363](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/8363) by [Denis Engemann](https://github.com/dengemann),
[Guillaume Lemaitre](https://github.com/glemaitre), [Olivier Grisel](https://twitter.com/ogrisel), [Raghav RV](https://github.com/raghavrv),
[Thierry Guillemot](https://github.com/tguillemot), and [Gael Varoquaux](http://gael-varoquaux.info).
* The new solver `'mu'` implements a Multiplicate Update in
[`decomposition.NMF`](modules/generated/sklearn.decomposition.NMF.html#sklearn.decomposition.NMF "sklearn.decomposition.NMF"), allowing the optimization of all
beta\-divergences, including the Frobenius norm, the generalized
Kullback\-Leibler divergence and the Itakura\-Saito divergence.
[\#5295](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/5295) by [Tom Dupre la Tour](https://github.com/TomDLT).

Model selection and evaluation

* [`model_selection.GridSearchCV`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV.html#sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV "sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV") and
[`model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV.html#sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV "sklearn.model_selection.RandomizedSearchCV") now support simultaneous
evaluation of multiple metrics. Refer to the
[Specifying multiple metrics for evaluation](modules/grid_search.html#multimetric-grid-search) section of the user guide for more
information. [\#7388](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7388) by [Raghav RV](https://github.com/raghavrv)
* Added the [`model_selection.cross_validate`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate.html#sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate "sklearn.model_selection.cross_validate") which allows evaluation
of multiple metrics. This function returns a dict with more useful
information from cross\-validation such as the train scores, fit times and
score times.
Refer to [The cross\_validate function and multiple metric evaluation](modules/cross_validation.html#multimetric-cross-validation) section of the userguide
for more information. [\#7388](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7388) by [Raghav RV](https://github.com/raghavrv)
* Added [`metrics.mean_squared_log_error`](modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.mean_squared_log_error.html#sklearn.metrics.mean_squared_log_error "sklearn.metrics.mean_squared_log_error"), which computes
the mean square error of the logarithmic transformation of targets,
particularly useful for targets with an exponential trend.
[\#7655](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7655) by [Karan Desai](https://github.com/karandesai-96).
* Added `metrics.dcg_score` and `metrics.ndcg_score`, which
compute Discounted cumulative gain (DCG) and Normalized discounted
cumulative gain (NDCG).
[\#7739](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7739) by [David Gasquez](https://github.com/davidgasquez).
* Added the [`model_selection.RepeatedKFold`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.RepeatedKFold.html#sklearn.model_selection.RepeatedKFold "sklearn.model_selection.RepeatedKFold") and
[`model_selection.RepeatedStratifiedKFold`](modules/generated/sklearn.model_selection.RepeatedStratifiedKFold.html#sklearn.model_selection.RepeatedStratifiedKFold "sklearn.model_selection.RepeatedStratifiedKFold").
[\#8120](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/8120) by [Neeraj Gangwar](http://neerajgangwar.in).
* Added a scorer based on [`metrics.explained_variance_score`](modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.explained_variance_score.html#sklearn.metrics.explained_variance_score "sklearn.metrics.explained_variance_score").
[\#9259](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9259) by [Hanmin Qin](https://github.com/qinhanmin2014).

Miscellaneous

* Validation that input data contains no NaN or inf can now be suppressed
using [`config_context`](modules/generated/sklearn.config_context.html#sklearn.config_context "sklearn.config_context"), at your own risk. This will save on runtime,
and may be particularly useful for prediction time. [\#7548](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7548) by
[Joel Nothman](http://joelnothman.com).
* Added a test to ensure parameter listing in docstrings match the
function/class signature. [\#9206](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/9206) by [Alexandre Gramfort](http://alexandre.gramfort.net) and
[Raghav RV](https://github.com/raghavrv).

#### Enhancements[¶](#id2 "Permalink to this headline")

Trees and ensembles

* The `min_weight_fraction_leaf` constraint in tree construction is now
more efficient, taking a fast path to declare a node a leaf if its weight
is less than 2 \* the minimum. Note that the constructed tree will be
different from previous versions where `min_weight_fraction_leaf` is
used. [\#7441](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7441) by [Nelson Liu](https://github.com/nelson-liu).
* [`ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier.html#sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier "sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingClassifier") and [`ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor.html#sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor "sklearn.ensemble.GradientBoostingRegressor")
now support sparse input for prediction.
[\#6101](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/6101) by [Ibraim Ganiev](https://github.com/olologin).
* [`ensemble.VotingClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier.html#sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier "sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier") now allows changing estimators by using
[`ensemble.VotingClassifier.set_params`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier.html#sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier.set_params "sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier.set_params"). An estimator can also be
removed by setting it to `None`.
[\#7674](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7674) by [Yichuan Liu](https://github.com/yl565).
* [`tree.export_graphviz`](modules/generated/sklearn.tree.export_graphviz.html#sklearn.tree.export_graphviz "sklearn.tree.export_graphviz") now shows configurable number of decimal
places. [\#8698](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/8698) by [Guillaume Lemaitre](https://github.com/glemaitre).
* Added `flatten_transform` parameter to [`ensemble.VotingClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier.html#sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier "sklearn.ensemble.VotingClassifier")
to change output shape of transform method to 2 dimensional.
[\#7794](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/7794) by [Ibraim Ganiev](https://github.com/olologin) and
[Herilalaina Rakotoarison](https://github.com/herilalaina).

Linear, kernelized and related models

* [`linear_model.SGDClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.SGDClassifier.html#sklearn.linear_model.SGDClassifier "sklearn.linear_model.SGDClassifier"), [`linear_model.SGDRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.SGDRegressor.html#sklearn.linear_model.SGDRegressor "sklearn.linear_model.SGDRegressor"),
[`linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier.html#sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier "sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveClassifier"),
[`linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor.html#sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor "sklearn.linear_model.PassiveAggressiveRegressor") and
[`linear_model.Perceptron`](modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.Perceptron.html#sklearn.linear_model.Perceptron "sklearn.linear_model.Perceptron") now expose `max_iter` and
`tol` parameters, to handle convergence more precisely.
